title: Reflection
text:
I used ChatGPT to troubleshoot a GitHub authentication issue on my laptop. My local Git was linked to a different GitHub account, so I kept getting a “permission denied” error when pushing.



ChatGPT guided me to: - check the remote repository URL (git remote -v) - clear cached credentials stored on my computer - authenticate correctly (via browser / token) so I could push to the correct GitHub account
Without fixing this, I would not have been able to push my Quarto website to GitHub.



I learned that being “logged in” in an app is not the same as Git authentication. Git uses stored credentials and the remote URL, so verifying both is important when push fails.
